trans-unit.source: Provides basic functionality for controls that display a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> when a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton"></xref>, <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem"></xref>, or <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton"></xref> control is clicked.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> is the abstract base class for <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton>, which can host items directly or host additional items in a drop-down container.

You do this by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> property to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> and setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.Items%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown>.
Access these drop-down items directly through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownItems%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> class.

You must derive a drop-down control from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> control.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> class with the specified display text, image, and action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.

You must derive a drop-down control from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> control.
The display text of the drop-down control.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the control.
The action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> class with the specified display text, image, and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> collection that the drop-down control contains.

You must derive a drop-down control from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> class in order to have any drop-down functionality for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownButton>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem>, or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> control.
The display text of the drop-down control.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref> collection that the drop-down control contains.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> class with the specified display text, image, action to take when the drop-down control is clicked, and control name.
The display text of the drop-down control.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> to be displayed on the control.
The action to take when the drop-down control is clicked.
The name of the control.
Creates a new accessibility object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem"></xref>.
Creates a generic <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> for which events can be defined.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.CreateDefaultDropDown%2A> method is automatically called if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> property finds no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem>.
The created <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> object.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> that will be displayed when this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> is clicked.

If no <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem>, a call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.CreateDefaultDropDown%2A> creates a generic drop-down control.

If a drop-down control is automatically generated, which means that items are added to the collection, and you then set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> property to an explicit drop-down control, you might lose data.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> closes.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets a value indicating the direction in which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> emerges from its parent container.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
The property is set to a value that is not one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownDirection"></xref> values.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets the collection of items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownItems%2A> property to get all the items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> that is referred to by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemCollection"></xref> of controls.
Gets the screen coordinates, in pixels, of the upper-left corner of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref>.
A `Point` representing the x and y screen coordinates, in pixels.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> has opened.
This event occurs when the user clicks the drop down item or when you call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.ShowDropDown%2A> method.
You can use this event to dynamically populate the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown>.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Occurs as the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> is opening.
For more information about handling events, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> has been created.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> has been created otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> has <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> controls associated with it.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> has <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> controls; otherwise, `false`.
Makes a visible <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown"></xref> hidden.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.HideDropDown%2A> method to prevent the user from choosing one of the options available on the associated <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown> control.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Bounds"></xref> property changes.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownClosed"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnDropDownClosed%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raised in response to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.HideDropDown"></xref> method.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnDropDownHide%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownItemClicked"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnDropDownItemClicked%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemClickedEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownOpened"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnDropDownOpened%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raised in response to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.ShowDropDown"></xref> method.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnDropDownShow%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown.FontChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.OnFontChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.RightToLeftChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> is in the pressed state.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> is in the pressed state; otherwise, `false`.
Processes a command key.
This method is called during message preprocessing to handle command keys.
Command keys are keys that always take precedence over regular input keys.
Examples of command keys include accelerators and menu shortcuts.
The method must return `true` to indicate that it has processed the command key, or `false` to indicate that the key is not a command key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem> implementation of this method calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip.ProcessCmdKey%2A> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> if there are items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDownItems%2A> collection.
Otherwise, this implementation calls the base class implementation.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref>, passed by reference, that represents the window message to process.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
`false` in all cases.
Processes a dialog key.
This method is called during message preprocessing to handle the UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, ENTER, and SPACEBAR keys in order to navigate the hierarchy of drop-down menus.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> values that represents the key to process.
`true` if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, `false`.
Displays the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> control associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.ShowDropDown%2A> method to display the drop-down controls that have been set by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem.DropDown%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem"></xref> is the same as the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip"></xref>.
